result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Angel Gomez

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
4:54 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan Gomez appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Solomon H Gatton appeared by phone for Jonathan Gomez. 
Court received Doctor's report- Deft. is not competent at this time but likely to regain with statutory time frame. Incompetent to refuse medication.
Defense received report and reviewed. Defense had a hard time reviewing with Deft. Request Court make findings.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Victim(F.G) in courtroom and makes a statement to the Court.
Court finds Deft. is not competent at this time to assist in his defense but likely to regain if treated with medication. Court finds probable cause. Court orders Deft. be committed to a facility for treatment. Court stays proceedings.
Defense- Sentence credit is 33 days.
Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Competency hearing on August 8, 2022 at 04:30 pm.

for Competency Exam sent to the Court for signature 
(form CF-205)
Competency hearing on July 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:47 PM Defendant Jonathan Angel Gomez appeared by phone. Atty Gatton on behalf of defendant by phone.   Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gatton raising competency based on contact w/defendant at Initial Appearance on 7.6.22. State takes no position.
Court orders competency exam/1 exam for both cases (21CF895).
Competency hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements - UA's

12:02 PM Defendant Jonathan Angel Gomez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Solomon H Gatton appeared by video for Jonathan Angel Gomez.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Advised of Rights. Complaint received, waived reading. Atty Gatton raises competency.
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
